content.openingParagraph: We are writing in response to your denial letter dated December 15, 2024 regarding the above-referenced claim. After careful review of your findings, we respectfully disagree with several key points and wish to present additional evidence that supports full coverage under the policy.

disputePoints.title: Denial of roof replacement due to "wear and tear"
disputePoints.detail: Our inspection clearly shows hail impact damage consistent with the April 3, 2024 storm. Granule loss patterns, mat exposure, and bruising are all classic indicators of acute storm damage, not gradual deterioration. Weather correlation report confirms 2-inch hail at property location.

disputePoints.title: Undervaluation of interior water damage
disputePoints.detail: Your estimate assumes only surface repairs. Our scope documents structural damage to ceiling joists and insulation requiring replacement per building code. Attached engineering report confirms structural assessment.

disputePoints.title: Exclusion of code upgrade costs
disputePoints.detail: Policy coverage includes "ordinance or law" coverage up to $50,000. Current code requires ice & water shield installation, upgraded ventilation, and impact-resistant materials. These are not optional upgrades but mandatory compliance items.

evidence: Itemized contractor estimates from 3 licensed contractors
content.closingParagraph: Based on the evidence presented, we request full reconsideration of this claim. We are prepared to arrange a joint inspection with your field adjuster and our engineer to review the damage in person. Please respond within 15 business days with your revised determination or a proposal for dispute resolution.
content.enclosures: Engineering Report, Weather Data, Contractor Estimates, Photo Documentation
